page.title: 01REVIEW OF BRECHIN BLOCK
page.content: The block lies in the centre of the {Strathmore Valley}in eastern{Angus. The relief is gently undulating lowland. The topography,soils and climate are ideal for{arable farming and this covers the western 3/4 of the block. The rural landscape is divided into a dozen farms. Brechin Castle,in its wooded grounds,lies in the south east corner.The other 1.5 sq.klm. contains the centre of the historic burgh of{Brechin}and the northern and western suburbs of the town. The town centre with its market place, cathedral,sandstone buildings and narrow streets has retained much of its old character. The suburbs are mainly residential but contain a large High Shool opened in 1970. The A94 trunk road,with a bypass,bisects the block. Below the fields gas and oil pipelines flow from the North sea.
